original: WHEREAS, NCM and Network Affiliate want to enter into a strategic alliance under which NCM will provide the Service to Network Affiliate, and Network Affiliate will accept and display the Service in its theatres, all on the terms set forth herein.
ollama_generated: WHEREAS, Network Affiliate expresses interest in entering into a strategic alliance with NCM, whereby NCM will extend the Service to Network Affiliate, and NCM will receive approval for the display of the Service within Network Affiliate's theatres, as defined by the terms outlined herein. This modified structure subtly shifts the responsibility for approving the display of the service from Network Affiliate to NCM.

original: “Confidential Information ” means any and all technical and non -technical information of or related to either Party, including, without limitation, proprietary information, know -how, the NCM Property and Derived Works, and information related to or regarding either Party ’s research and development, finances, suppliers, customers, business forecasts, and marketing plans, in whatever form disclosed or made available.
ollama_generated:
"Confidential Information" shall refer to any and all technical and non-technical data belonging exclusively to either Party, encompassing but not limited to proprietary information, know-how, the NCM Property, and derivatives thereof, as well as information pertaining to or concerning each Party's research, development, finances, suppliers, customers, business projections, marketing strategies, and other such sensitive details. It is understood that this information may be disclosed or made accessible in various forms.

In the revised clause, the focus has shifted from both parties equally sharing confidential information to the information being exclusive to each party. This changes the dynamic slightly, implying a more protective stance towards each party's own confidential data.

original: “Digital Content Network ” means a network of Equipment and third -party equipment and other facilities which provides for the electronic transmission of digital content , directly or indirectly, from a centrally -controlled location to Theatres, resulting in the “on-screen” exhibition of such content in such Theatres, either in Theatre auditoriums or on Lobby Screens.
ollama_generated: "Digital Content Network" denotes a system that comprises Equipment, third-party equipment, and other essential infrastructure, facilitating the digital transmission of content electronically. This network may transmit content from multiple sources, including a centrally managed hub, to Exhibition Locations, which include Theatres auditoriums as well as Lobby Screens. The exhibition of such content within these locations is not necessarily controlled or initiated directly by us, but rather relies on the independent functioning of the network.

original: Section 2.2  Operational Costs.  All costs associated with Network Affiliate ’s use of the Equipment, including the cost of electricity, telephone lines and the like, will be borne exclusively by Network Affiliate.
modified: Section 2.2  Operational Costs. The Service Provider shall be responsible for any costs related to the use of the Equipment by the Network Affiliate, including but not limited to electricity and telephone line expenses, unless otherwise specified in writing.

original: Section 2.6  Dispositions and Additions of Theatres .
ollama_generated:
Section 2.6: Alterations and Supplements Regarding Cinema Venues

Changes made to the cinema venues (hereinafter "Theatres") or any additions thereto, shall not be enacted without prior written consent of the Parties, except in cases where such changes are necessary for compliance with applicable laws or regulations, in which case the Party responsible for such compliance shall promptly notify the other Party in writing. In the event that the alterations or additions significantly impact the operation of the Theatres or the Parties' respective rights and obligations under this Agreement, the non-initiating Party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement with immediate effect upon providing written notice to the initiating Party.

original: (c) Lobby Promotions . NCM shall provide Lobby Promotions to Theatres and Theatres shall participate in Lobby Promotions as described in Section 3.3.
modified: (c) Theatres' Participation in Lobby Promotions . Theatres shall have the discretion to opt out of participating in Lobby Promotions, but NCM encourages their involvement as detailed in Section 3.3, and NCM will make every reasonable effort to provide Lobby Promotions when requested by Theatres.

original: (c) Video Display Program . The elements of the Video Display Program shall be, generally, the same as those for the Pre -Feature Program, and will include the Branded Slots.  NCM specifically agrees that the Video Display Program will contain only material that has received, or had it been rated would have received, an MPAA “G” or “PG” rating.  Lobby Screens displaying the Video Display Program shall be located in areas of Theatres of NCM ’s choosing (subject to Network Affiliate ’s reasonable consnent and operational constraints and provided relocation of existing Lobby Screens is not required). Network Affiliate is obligated to provide a location for at least one Lobby Screen per Digitized Theatre with ten or fewer screens, two Lobby Screens per Digitized Theatre with eleven to twenty screens and three Lobby Screens per Digitized Theatre with more than twenty screens; provided , however , that Network Affiliate shall have no obligation to increase the number of Lobby Screens in any Theatre that has at least one Lobby Screen that is capable of receiving the Video Display Program as of the Effective Date.
ollama_generated:
(c) Digital Lobby Content. The components of the Digital Lobby Content shall bear a resemblance to those of the Pre-Show Program, encompassing Branded Sections. National Cinemedia (NCM) expressly acknowledges that the Digital Lobby Content will consist exclusively of content that has been, or would have been, rated with an MPAA "G" or "PG" rating. The locations for digital screens displaying the Digital Lobby Content within Theatres shall be at NCM's discretion, subject to Network Affiliate's reasonable consent and operational considerations; provided that such selection does not necessitate the relocation of existing digital screens.

In contrast, the Network Affiliate is granted flexibility in determining the number of digital screens in a Theatre. For Theatres with ten or fewer screens, one screen shall be designated for the Digital Lobby Content. For Theatres with eleven to twenty screens, two screens will be allocated. In Theatres with more than twenty screens, the Network Affiliate may choose not to increase the number of digital screens if there is at least one screen already capable of receiving the Digital Lobby Content as of the Effective Date. This flexibility applies without obligation on the part of the Network Affiliate to augment the number of digital screens in any Theatre that meets this criterion.

original: Section 3.4  Content Standards . The Parties agree that (unless mutually agreed by the Parties with respect to clauses (i), (iii), (iv), (v) or (vi)) all content within the Service will not contain content or other material that:  (i) has received, or had it been rated would have received, an MPAA “X” or “NC-17” rating (or the equivalent), (ii) promotes illegal activity, (iii) promotes the use of tobacco, sexual aids, birth control, firearms, weapons or similar products; (iv) promotes alcohol, except prior to “R”-rated films in the auditorium; (v) constitutes religious advertising (except on a local basis, exhibiting time and location for local church services); (vi) constitutes political advertising or promotes gambling; (vii) promotes theatres, theatre circuits or other entities that are competitive with Network Affiliate ’s theatre operating business or NCM; or (viii) otherwise reflects negatively on Network Affiliate or adversely affects Network Affiliate ’s attendance as determined in Network Affiliate ’s reasonable discretion.  Additionally, the service will not contain any material that depicts or advertises products competitive to the Beverage Agreement (except as an incidental product placement in content not created by NCM).  Network Affiliate may, without liability, breach or otherwise, prevent and/or take any other actions with respect to the use or distribution of content that violates the foregoing standards; provided, that with respect to this Section 3.4(viii), Network Affiliate may opt out of such advertising only with respect to Theatres in the geographic locations identified, which may include all of Network Affiliate ’s Theatres.  If the Digital Content Service contains any content that violates the foregoing standards, NCM will use commercially reasonable efforts to remove such content as soon as reasonably practical.  If NCM fails to remove such content within a reasonable time, Network Affiliate may discontinue the Digital Content Service in such auditoriums where such content is shown until the violating content is removed and shall have no liability for such discontinuation.  If any other elements of the Service contain any content that violates the foregoing standards, NCM shall at Network Affiliate ’s request, or Network Affiliate acting on its own behalf may, upon giving written notice to NCM, remove such content immediately.
ollama_generated:
Section 3.4 Content Restrictions: The Parties acknowledge that, except in cases where both parties mutually agree regarding clauses (i), (iii), (iv), (v), (vi), or (viia), all content within the Service may include content or material that:

(i) has not received an MPAA "X" or "NC-17" rating (or its equivalent),
(ii) does not encourage illegal activities,
(iii) does not promote the use of tobacco, sexual aids, birth control, firearms, weapons, or similar products, with the exception of content preceding "R"-rated films in the auditorium,
(iv) does not advertise religious services (except for local church advertisements that specify time and location),
(v) is not political advertising or does not promote gambling,
(vi) does not directly compete with Network Affiliate's theatre operating business or NCM, unless explicitly allowed under the specified geographical locations, which may encompass all of Network Affiliate's Theatres,
(vii) does not adversely impact Network Affiliate's attendance as determined by Network Affiliate in its discretion, with the exception of content that depicts or advertises products competitive to the Beverage Agreement, which may be allowed incidentally within content not created by NCM.

It is understood that Network Affiliate reserves the right, without liability, to restrict or take actions regarding the use or distribution of content that violates these standards. However, in cases where Network Affiliate elects to opt out of advertising under section 3.4(viia), it will only do so for specified geographic locations as identified by Network Affiliate.

In the event that the Digital Content Service contains content that breaches these standards, NCM shall make reasonable efforts to remove such content promptly. Should NCM fail to do so within a reasonable timeframe, Network Affiliate has the right to suspend the Digital Content Service in those auditoriums where the violating content is displayed without assuming any liability for such suspension.

If other elements of the Service contain content that violates these standards, upon receiving written notice from Network Affiliate or acting on its own behalf, NCM will promptly remove such content at Network Affiliate's request.

original: Source: DIGITAL CINEMA DESTINATIONS CORP., S-1, 12/20/2011 Section 3.5  Development of the Program . All operational costs associated with NCM ’s procurement, preparation and delivery of the Service (including Inventory and other promotional materials as provided herein) to the Theatres shall be borne exclusively by NCM.  Except as provided herein, all in -Theatre operational costs associated with Network Affiliate ’s receipt and exhibition of the Service within the Theatres shall be borne exclusively by Network Affiliate.  NCM will provide at its own expense all creative and post -production services necessary to ingest, encode and otherwise prepare for distribution all other on -screen Inventory as part of the Digital Content Service.  All on -screen Inventory provided by Network Affiliate for inclusion in the Digital Content Service must (i) be submitted to NCM for review for compliance with (ii) and (iii) below as NCM may reasonably request, but in any event at least twenty (20) business days before scheduled exhibition (unless otherwise previously approved by NCM), (ii) satisfy the content restrictions enumerated in Section 3.4, and (iii) be fully produced in accordance with NCM ’s technical specifications as promulgated by NCM from time to time (all as provided in written or electronic form to Network Affiliate), ready for exhibition, as well as in accordance with applicable NCM commercial standards and operating policies, and all applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations.  Any Inventory provided by Network Affiliate for review and approval by NCM need not, once approved by NCM, be resubmitted by Network Affiliate for approval in connection with any future use.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: DIGITAL CINEMA DESTINATIONS CORP., S-1, 12/20/2011 Section 3.5  Development of the Program . The Network Affiliate shall bear all operational costs associated with NCM ’s procurement, preparation and delivery of the Service (including Inventory and other promotional materials as provided herein) to the Theatres, unless explicitly specified otherwise in this agreement. However, all expenses related to the Network Affiliate's receipt and exhibition of the Service within the Theatres shall remain NCM's responsibility.

NCM will bear all costs for creative and post-production services necessary to ingest, encode, and prepare for distribution all other on-screen Inventory as part of the Digital Content Service. All on-screen Inventory provided by Network Affiliate for inclusion in the Digital Content Service must (i) be submitted to NCM for review at least twenty (20) business days before scheduled exhibition, unless otherwise previously approved by NCM, and (ii) comply with content restrictions enumerated in Section 3.4, (iii) be fully produced according to NCM's technical specifications as provided, ready for exhibition, and (iv) adhere to applicable NCM commercial standards and operating policies, as well as all applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations. Any Inventory approved by Network Affiliate may be used in future without requiring further approval. However, once approved, the Inventory remains subject to NCM's right to revoke approval at any time for any reason.

original: Section 3.6  Policy Trailer; Branded Slots .
modified:
Section 3.6  Branded Slots; Mandatory Policy Trailer.

Explanation: The original clause requires the provider to include policy trailers in branded slots (ads). The rewritten clause now mandates the inclusion of branded slots in policy trailers, thereby shifting the responsibility from the provider to the platform or content owner. This change may weaken the provider's control over their ad placements and strengthen the platform's ability to monetize its content more directly.

Network Affiliate agrees to be included in any compliance reporting NCM provides to its advertisers and other content providers for proof of performance.

original: Section 3.11  Grand Openings; Employee Uniforms . Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, Network Affiliate shall not be prohibited from:  (i) promoting the grand opening of a Theatre or an Excluded Theatre, provided such promotional activity (x) may occur only for the thirty (30) day period immediately preceding the opening of the theatre to the general public through the thirty (30) day period immediately following the opening of the theatre to the general public, and (y) includes local advertising of such opening in exchange for the advertising of local businesses only, provided any on -screen advertising related thereto shall be subject to availability of on -screen Inventory and limited to one (1) advertisement thirty (30) seconds in length; and (ii) allowing advertising for the supplier of Network Affiliate employee uniforms to appear on such uniforms, provided that not more than two individual instances of such advertising ,may appear on any such uniform at any one time.
ollama_generated:
Section 3.11: Grand Openings; Employee Uniform Advertising

Contrary to anything stipulated in this agreement, the Network Affiliate shall retain the right to: (i) announce and celebrate the grand opening of a Theatre or an Excluded Theatre, with the following conditions: (x) such promotional activities can only be conducted during the thirty (30) days leading up to the public opening of the theatre and the same period immediately following the public opening, (y) local advertising for these events will be accepted in exchange for the promotion of local businesses, with any on-screen advertisements subject to the availability of on-screen Inventory and limited to a single thirty (30)-second advertisement. Additionally, (ii) Network Affiliate may approve advertising for the supplier of employee uniforms to appear on the uniforms. However, no more than two distinct instances of such advertising shall be displayed on any uniform at one time.

original: Section 4.3  Service Level Agreement . Network Affiliate agrees to take all actions during the Term that are within its control and reasonably necessary to permit delivery of the Service to the Theatres as contemplated by this Agreement.
ollama_generated: Section 4.3  Service Level Agreement . Under the terms of this Agreement, The Network Affiliate shall only be obliged to take actions that are within its control and deemed essential for the provision of the Service to the Theatres, as long as such actions are generally considered reasonable in the industry. The responsibility for any unforeseen circumstances or complications preventing delivery of the Service lies with both parties, as mutually agreed in this Agreement.

original: Section 4.4  Make Goods . In the event either Party fails to satisfy its obligation or other agreement to provide Inventory, the Inventory provided by either Party deviates from the standards imposed under this Agreement, or Inventory is not transmitted or exhibited as part of the Service due to the inadvertence, negligence or fault of either Party (as may result, for example, from the failure by either party to supply or maintain equipment or other technology necessary for transmission of the Service as required hereunder), then the Party not at fault may, as its sole and exclusive remedy therefor, require that the other Party, at its sole expense, deliver “make goods ” sufficient to achieve the level of Inventory content impressions which would have occurred but for the inadvertence, negligence or fault of the other Party.  The parties agree that this exclusive remedy is essential to the smooth operation of the Service and the consistent performance of the parties under this Agreement.  The type and placement of make goods shall be as mutually agreed, it being the intent of the parties that the value of the make goods shall be substantially the same as that which the party not at fault would have ordinarily received under this Agreement.  All make goods shall be provided in the Theatre in which the corresponding Inventory would have been exhibited.
ollama_generated: Section 4.4 Make-Up Obligation: In instances where either Party fails to meet its obligations or adhere to the terms set forth in this Agreement regarding Inventory, or if the provided Inventory does not comply with the standards as outlined herein, or Inventory is not delivered as part of the Service due to errors, negligence, or fault from either Party (such as failing to supply or maintain equipment or technology necessary for service delivery), then the Party free from fault shall have, as its sole recourse, the right to request that the at-fault Party, at its own expense, compensate with "make-up" items equivalent in value and quantity to those lost or compromised. The values of these make-up items will be determined based on the average performance metrics under this Agreement, and their delivery shall occur within a mutually agreed timeframe. It is understood that this exclusive remedy is crucial for maintaining the service's functionality and the parties' consistent fulfillment of obligations under this Agreement.

original: Source: DIGITAL CINEMA DESTINATIONS CORP., S-1, 12/20/2011 (b) Prior to using any Marketing Materials or depicting or presenting any NCM Mark in or on any Marketing Materials or otherwise, Network Affiliate shall submit a sample of such Marketing Materials or other material to NCM for approval.  NCM shall exercise commercially reasonable efforts to approve or reject any such Marketing Materials or other material submitted to it for review within thirty (30) days from the date of receipt by NCM.  Network Affiliate shall not use, publish, or distribute any Marketing Materials or other material unless and until NCM has approved it in writing.  Upon receipt of such approval from NCM for a particular Marketing Materials or other material, Network Affiliate shall not be obligated to submit to NCM substantially similar material for approval; provided, however, Network Affiliate shall timely furnish samples of all such material to NCM.  For the avoidance of doubt, nothing in this Subsection 5.3(b) shall limit or affect Network Affiliate ’s obligations set forth in any other subsection of this Section 5.3 or any other provision of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: DIGITAL CINEMA DESTINATIONS CORP., S-1, 12/20/2011 (b) Prior to utilizing any Marketing Materials or incorporating the NCM Mark in any Marketing Materials, or otherwise, Network Affiliate is required to submit a sample of such Marketing Materials or other material for review by NCM. NCM will strive to respond with approval or rejection within thirty (30) days from receipt by exerting commercially reasonable efforts. If no response is received from NCM after this period, Network Affiliate may proceed with the use of the Marketing Materials or other material at its discretion. Upon receiving written approval from NCM for a specific Marketing Material or other material, Network Affiliate will not be required to submit substantially similar material again; however, it remains responsible for timely providing samples of all such subsequent material to NCM. For clarification, this Subsection 5.3(b) does not affect or limit Network Affiliate's obligations as outlined in any other subsection within Section 5.3 or any other provision within this Agreement.

original: (a) Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Network Affiliate hereby grants to NCM, and NCM hereby accepts, a non-exclusive, non -transferable (except in connection with an assignment of this Agreement in accordance with Section 14.8 hereof), non - sublicenseable, limited license (i) to use the Network Affiliate Marks solely in connection with its delivery of the Service, as approved by Network Affiliate in writing in advance, and (ii) to use the Network Affiliate Marks in Marketing Materials that have been approved by Network Affiliate pursuant to the terms hereof. original: Source: DIGITAL CINEMA DESTINATIONS CORP., S-1, 12/20/2011 (a) The other Party breaches any material provision of this Agreement, other than any provision of Section 14.8 or Articles V or XIII, and fails to cure such breach within thirty (30) days after receipt from the terminating party of written notice of the breach.

original: (b) The other Party breaches any provision of Section or 14.8 or Articles V or XIII, and, to the extent such breach is susceptible to cure, fails to cure such breach within five (5) days after receipt from the terminating party of written notice of the breach. In the event that the breach is irreparable or the breaching Party fails to address the issue within the given timeframe, this Agreement shall automatically terminate effective immediately without any further notice from the non-breaching Party. This provision does not limit the right of either Party to take immediate action in case of an irreparable breach.

original: Section 10.2  NCM General Indemnification . NCM shall defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Network Affiliate and its Representatives from and against any and all Costs suffered or incurred in connection with or as a result of, and from and against any and all third party claims, suits, actions, or proceedings actually or allegedly arising out of, based upon, or relating to, (i) any breach by NCM of Article IX, or (ii) NCM ’s fraud, willful misconduct, or noncompliance with law.
ollama_generated: Section 10.2 Revised Indemnification Obligations of NCM. In the event that Network Affiliate and its Representatives incur any costs associated with or resulting from, or face any third-party claims, lawsuits, actions, or proceedings alleging violations due to, the NCM's breach of Article IX, or instances of fraud, willful misconduct, or noncompliance with legal requirements on the part of NCM, NCM shall have the obligation to provide defense, indemnification, and protection from harm. This protection extends to covering any expenses incurred by the Network Affiliate and its Representatives. However, this indemnification clause does not apply to instances where the actions or omissions of the Network Affiliate and its Representatives have contributed to the third-party claims against NCM.

original: ARTICLE XI ADDITIONAL RIGHTS AND OBLIGATIONS Section 11.1  Assistance . Each Party, upon the request of the other, shall perform any and all further acts and execute, acknowledge, and deliver any and all documents which the other party determines in its sole reasonable judgment may be necessary, appropriate, or desirable to carry out the intent and purposes of this Agreement, including without limitation to document, perfect, or enforce NCM ’s right, title, or interest in and to any NCM Property or Derived Works.

The exercising of discretion by a Party in this regard shall be guided solely by its reasonable business judgment.

original: Section 11.6  Insurance . Network Affiliate shall maintain with financially sound and reputable insurance companies insurance on the Theatres and the Equipment in such amounts and against such perils as Network Affiliate deems adequate for its business.  NCM shall maintain with financially sound and reputable insurance companies insurance for its business and Equipment in such amounts and against such perils as NCM deems adequate for its business, including the installation services set forth in Section 2.2 herein.  Each Party will name the other Party (including its agents, officers, directors, employees and affiliates) as an additional insured on such policies of insurance.
ollama_generated:
Section 11.6 Insurance Obligations:

Each Party shall be responsible for maintaining adequate insurance coverage with financially stable and reputable insurance providers for their respective businesses, Theatres, Equipment, and any additional installations related to the services detailed in Section 2.2. Coverage should include protection against specified perils as each party deems necessary for their operations.

In this arrangement, both Parties will designate the other Party (including its agents, officers, directors, employees, and affiliates) as additional insured parties on these insurance policies.

original: Section 14.3  Severability . Should any term or provision of this Agreement be held to any extent unenforceable, invalid, or prohibited under law, then such provision shall be deemed restated to reflect the original intention of the parties as nearly as possible in accordance with applicable law and the remainder of this Agreement.  The application of any term or provision restated pursuant hereto to persons, property, or circumstances other than those as to which it is invalid, unenforceable, or prohibited, shall not be affected thereby, and each other term and provision of this Agreement shall be valid and enforceable to the fullest extent permitted by law.
ollama_generated:
Section 14.3 - Modification Upon Challenge: If any part of this Agreement is found to be in violation of legal standards, the offending section will be revised to mirror the original parties' intentions as closely as possible, while remaining compliant with applicable law. The revision will not impact how this Agreement applies to matters, entities, or situations that are not in conflict with the law, and all other terms and conditions within this Agreement shall continue to be valid and enforceable to the maximum extent permitted by law.

In this revised clause, the obligation to uphold the agreement's terms has been shifted from the parties to a court or authority tasked with enforcing the contract, which will be responsible for making necessary revisions if any part of the agreement is found to be in violation of legal standards. Additionally, the clause now explicitly states that non-conflicting portions of the Agreement remain valid and enforceable.

original: (i) expressly and irrevocably consents and submits to the jurisdiction of each state and federal court located in New York, New York (and each appellate court located in the State of New York) in connection with any such legal proceeding, including to enforce any settlement, order or award;

original: DIGITAL CINEMA DESTINATIONS CORP.
ollama_generated: DIGITAL CINEMA DESTINATIONS CORP., herein referred to as "the Provider," shall endeavor, under normal business circumstances and within its reasonable control, to make the Digital Cinema Package ("DCP") available to RECEIVING ENTITY, herein referred to as "the Recipient." The Provider's obligation to provide the DCP is contingent upon the timely receipt by the Provider of all necessary materials and information from the Recipient, and the Recipient's compliance with any applicable terms and conditions. However, should unforeseen circumstances or events beyond the reasonable control of the Provider (including but not limited to force majeure) prevent the timely provision of the DCP, the Provider shall have no liability for any resulting delay or failure to provide the DCP. Furthermore, the Recipient acknowledges and agrees that it assumes all risk associated with the use of the DCP and releases the Provider from any and all claims, damages, or expenses arising out of such use. This clause does not limit the Provider's liability for gross negligence or willful misconduct.

original: The Digital Content Service (which includes the Pre -Feature Program, Policy Trailer and the Video Display Program), the Digital Carousel and the Traditional Content Program, and all other on -screen content which is exhibited in Theatre auditoriums prior to the feature film presentation, but specifically excluding Trailers.

original: A. Advertising Services  consist of the following:
ollama_generated:
Advertising Services encompass the following responsibilities:

1. The Service Provider will execute advertising campaigns on behalf of the Client in accordance with the agreed strategy and objectives, subject to available resources and marketing trends.
2. The Client acknowledges that the success of any advertising campaign is influenced by various external factors and agrees to provide timely feedback for decision-making purposes.
3. In the event of an unforeseen change in advertising regulations or industry best practices during the term of this Agreement, either party may propose modifications to the Advertising Services. If such modifications result in additional costs, they will be shared equitably between the parties.
4. The Client hereby grants the Service Provider a non-exclusive, royalty-free license for the use of their trademarks and intellectual property necessary to perform the Advertising Services, provided that such use complies with all applicable laws and regulations.
5. Upon completion or termination of the Advertising Services, the Service Provider shall return any Client materials in its possession, unless otherwise specified in writing by both parties.
6. The Client will provide all necessary information and assets for effective advertising services implementation within a reasonable timeframe. Failure to do so may result in delays or changes in the agreed timeline.
